alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Chouteau; Eastern Teton; Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 1:09AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Judith Basin, southeastern Teton, southwestern Chouteau and northeastern Cascade Counties through 215 AM MDT... At 109 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles east of Power to 9 miles northeast of Great Falls to near Black Eagle to 16 miles west of Belt. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Fort Benton, Belt, Black Eagle, Highwood, Power, Carter, Floweree, Raynesford, Portage, Eden, Malmstrom Afb, Stockett, Tracy, Vaughn, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Centerville, Sun River, Shonkin and Armington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 267 and 303. Highway 200 between mile markers 0 and 10, and between mile markers 138 and 139. Highway 87 between mile markers 4 and 49. Highway 89 between mile markers 65 and 71, between mile markers 9 and 12, and between mile markers 72 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cascade; Chouteau; Eastern Teton; Judith Basin
